txt.en: 'The goblins that attacked my companions and I emerged from a cave to the north of here. We had no warning before they were upon us, and in such numbers that we had no chance.\n\n'I fear that others will suffer the same fate if the goblins are permitted to retain their hiding hole. If you would, go to their cave and collapse the entrance, then return to Ardwyn at Forthbrond and let him know that one threat has been removed.'
'Thank you for lending Cadthorn your aid. With the entrance to the goblin-cave collapsed, it should be some time before they are able to attack any more of our patrols or messengers.'
Cadthorn and his companions were attacked by goblins as they journeyed to Forthbrond from Edoras with important messages.
The goblin-cave lies to the north of Cadthorn's position, along the ridge.\n\nCadthorn has asked you to collapse the entrance of the goblin-cave.
Ardwyn is at Forthbrond, south of the goblin-cave.\n\nCadthorn asked you to return to Ardwyn with news of your success.
